snippet.heading: Centipedes are elongated metameric creatures with one pair of legs per body segment. Most centipedes are venomous and can inflict painful bites, injecting their venom through pincer-like appendages known as forcipules. ... Centipedes always have an odd number of pairs of legs. Therefore, no centipede has exactly 100 legs.

meta_description.text: Centipede, any of various long, flattened, many-segmented predaceous arthropods. Each segment except the hindmost bears one pair of legs.

meta_description.text: Centipede. The centipedes (Chilopoda) are predaceous and possess a pair of strong, poison-supplied fangs called toxicognaths used to hold and kill their prey.

people_also_ask.question: Are centipedes dangerous?
people_also_ask.heading: Centipede bites can be very painful to people. The larger the centipede, the more painful their bite may be. All centipedes use venom to kill their prey. Centipede bites rarely cause health complications in humans, and aren't typically dangerous or fatal.
people_also_ask.title: Centipede Bites: Pictures, Symptoms, First Aid, and More

people_also_ask.heading: Centipedes are carnivorous and venomous. They sting and eat their prey, which typically consists of insects and worms. ... All centipedes use venom to kill their prey. Centipede bites rarely cause health complications in humans, and aren't typically dangerous or fatal.
people_also_ask.title: Centipede Bites: Pictures, Symptoms, First Aid, and More

people_also_ask.question: Should I kill a centipede?
people_also_ask.heading: Here's why you should never kill a centipede you find in your house. House centipedes are known for killing pests, like roaches, moths, flies, and termites that might otherwise lurk under your furniture.10-May-2018
people_also_ask.title: Here's Why You Should Never Kill a House Centipede

people_also_ask.question: What happens if a centipede bites you?
people_also_ask.heading: Typically, bite victims have severe pain, swelling and redness at the site of the bite, with symptoms usually lasting less than 48 hours. Symptoms for those more sensitive to the venom's effects may also include headache, chest pain, heart tremors, nausea and vomiting. Victims from centipede bites are often gardeners.
people_also_ask.title: How to Identify Centipede Bites - Orkin

knowledge_panel.description: centipedes are predatory arthropods belonging to the class chilopoda of the subphylum myriapoda, an arthropod group which also includes millipedes and other multi-legged creatures. centipedes are elongated metameric creatures with one pair of legs per body segment. wikipedia
